title: Last Mile Lending Infrastructure for UNDP Bangladesh
summary: In UNDP Bangladesh’s context, last-mile microfinance is slow, costly and prone to fraud, limiting affordable loans and hurting beneficiaries who need fast, transparent, secure financial access.
solution: Leveraging blockchain to enable the climate resilience fund to deploy decentralised IDs, smart contracts, and tamper-proof tracking, restoring trust among donors, governments and communities.
proposer_relevant_experience:
**UNDP Bangladesh \(Country Office\)**

So our dependencies are the cooperatives and the users as well adopting the solution. Luckily, these cooperatives and beneficiaries were onboarded by UNDP Bangladesh onto this project, therefore UNDP has significant influence and say on adoption, since they are the ones who finance the fund that deploys the micro loans to communities. sub_fields.title: Please provide details on the intellectual property (IP) status of your project outputs, including whether they will be released as open source or retained under another licence.
sub_fields.description: Please provide details on the intellectual property (IP) status of your project outputs, including whether they will be released as open source or retained under another licence.
sub_fields.answer:
The intellectual property (IP) generated through this project will be owned by Cladfy Inc, the Tech partner/solution maker. All Tech outputs will be retained under Cladfy Inc’s proprietary licence and will not be released as open-source. 

Other non-tech outputs from the project e.g Impact metrics, process data, challenges, opportunities and so on will belong to UNDP Bangladesh and will be shared/published at their discretion

sub_fields.title: Describe your established collaborations.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale for your established collaborations.
sub_fields.answer:
The collaboration between UNDP Bangladesh & Cladfy Inc project came about from a partnership bewteen UNDP AltFinLab, Emurgo Labs and The Blockchain For Good Alliance, that brought together startups to help UNDP solve real world challenges through the Cardano Blockchain.



Cladfy Inc has a partnership with UNDP Bagladesh for this pilot project, and

The pilot will run for up to 12 months across up to 10 cooperatives serving up to  ~1000 beneficiaries.



UNDP has established partnersips with 248 local cooperatives and 42,000 beneficiaries/users as part of the Climate Resilience Fund. Post-pilot, we intend to scale up to cover all 248 cooperatives. UNDP has plans to scale up the entire project as well, to serve 150,000 beneficiaries in the coming years. This pilot will set the stage for massive impact in coming years.

sub_fields.title: Describe funding commitments.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale for your funding commitments.
sub_fields.answer: UNDP Bangladesh and Cladfy Inc have together committed $23,000 in cash and in-kind support to the project so far, providing critical resources to advance implementation and pilot activities effectively. We are fundraising for the rest of the pilot budget.

sub_fields.title: Describe your key performance metrics.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale for your key performance metrics.
sub_fields.answer:
1. % loans disbursed digitally.
2. Average time from loan request to disbursement.
3. Beneficiary satisfaction scores.
4. Number of cooperatives onboarded.
5. Donor confidence (audit trail transparency).
6. Scale of adoption (number of cooperatives, beneficiaries onboarded)

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
Bangladesh is one of the most climate-vulnerable countries in the world. Rural communities and smallholder farmers are disproportionately affected by flooding, salinity, and other climate shocks. Fund disbursement for climate adaptation programs often passes through multiple layers of intermediaries, creating delays, data gaps, and risks of mismanagement.



The key challenge in climate resilience programs like LoGIC (our project) is ensuring transparent and trustworthy fund disbursement and beneficiary tracking. Current centralized systems face risks of data tampering, fund leakages, high administrative costs, and difficulties verifying identities of marginalized groups, undermining stakeholder trust and future climate finance. 



Through this pilot, Blockchain offers a solution by enabling secure digital identities, automated fund releases via smart contracts, and immutable tracking of adaptation progress, restoring confidence among donors, governments, and communities while positioning Bangladesh as a leader in transparent, locally led climate adaptation.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
1. Showcases Real-World Impact: Demonstrates Cardano’s ability to power transparent, decentralized financial systems for social good, reinforcing its utility beyond speculative use.
2. Promotes DApp Adoption: By deploying a live cooperative finance system, the project drives practical use of Cardano smart contracts, UTxO accounting, and decentralized identities (DIDs), encouraging developers and enterprises to build on the platform.
3. Strengthens Ecosystem Credibility: Transparent, tamper-proof microfinance systems validate Cardano as a reliable platform for high-integrity, auditable financial solutions, attracting more institutional and donor interest.
4. Expands Developer & Partner Network: The project creates opportunities for partnerships with local fintechs, mobile money providers, and NGOs, fostering ecosystem growth and technical collaboration.
5. Data & Knowledge Sharing: Lessons learned on scalable blockchain-based lending, DID integration, and on-chain accountability provide valuable insights for Cardano developers, researchers, and other pilot projects globally.
6. Encourages Social Impact Projects: Success inspires other blockchain initiatives targeting financial inclusion, climate adaptation, and sustainable development, positioning Cardano as a hub for socially responsible innovation.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
Capability to Deliver with High Trust and Accountability

1. Blockchain-Based Transparency: Using Cardano’s UTxO model and smart contracts ensures every transaction is immutable, traceable, and auditable in real time. This eliminates ambiguity and builds confidence among all stakeholders.
2. Decentralized Identities (DIDs): Borrowers are verified through secure digital identities, preventing fraud and ensuring that only eligible beneficiaries access funds.
3. Direct-to-Beneficiary Disbursements: Loans are delivered straight to mobile wallets (e.g., bKash), reducing intermediaries and minimizing risk of fund leakage.
4. Automated Governance & Oversight: Smart contracts automate loan approval, disbursement, and repayment processes, ensuring rules are consistently applied without manual intervention.
5. Pilot with Reputable Partner (UNDP Bangladesh): Partnership with UNDP provides credibility, oversight, and alignment with international development standards.
6. Real-Time Monitoring & Reporting: Co-operative committees, UNDP, and auditors can track all activity on-chain, creating a tamper-proof record that enables accountability at every step.
7. Experienced Team: Cladfy Inc is an award-winning Fintech that brings technical expertise in blockchain development, fintech integration, and operational scaling to ensure reliable implementation and stakeholder confidence. 



Validating if our approach is feasible

1. Pilot Deployment: Launch a controlled pilot with a select group of verified borrowers and cooperatives, funded through UNDP Bangladesh, to test real-world loan disbursements and repayments.
2. Transaction Monitoring: Track all disbursements, repayments, and loan lifecycle events on-chain to assess accuracy, transparency, and efficiency compared to traditional manual systems.
3. User Feedback: Collect qualitative feedback from beneficiaries (especially women and low-income borrowers) and cooperative committees to evaluate usability, accessibility, and trust in the system.
4. Operational Metrics: Measure transaction processing times, error rates, and administrative cost reductions to validate operational efficiency.
5. Financial Integrity Checks: Audit smart contract execution, DID verification, and mobile wallet transfers to ensure funds are correctly allocated and tamper-proof.
6. Scalability Assessment: Test system performance under increasing transaction volumes and multiple cooperatives to determine readiness for broader deployment.
7. Stakeholder Reporting: Provide UNDP and other partners with real-time dashboards and reports to verify transparency, accountability, and impact.

sub_fields.answer: Pilot Setup & Onboarding

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer: The Cardano-based platform is fully configured and deployed, with 2–10 cooperatives onboarded and the first 100–200 beneficiaries verified with secure decentralized digital identities (DIDs), ensuring readiness for automated and transparent loan disbursements.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer: All selected cooperatives are registered on the platform, smart contracts are successfully deployed and operational, and at least 100–200 beneficiaries have verified DIDs and active accounts ready for the first loan cycle, with no critical errors.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer: Signed cooperative agreements, screenshots of active beneficiary accounts, verification logs of DIDs, deployment confirmation of smart contracts, and functional dashboard ready for live loan operations.

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
1. Demonstrates Real-World Utility: The project deploys Cardano smart contracts, UTxO accounting, and decentralized identities (DIDs) to solve actual microfinance challenges in Bangladesh. Every dollar spent directly showcases Cardano’s practical capabilities for secure, transparent, and scalable financial systems.
2. Drives Ecosystem Adoption: Funding supports integration with local mobile wallets, onboarding of cooperatives, and pilot testing with up to 1,000 beneficiaries. The pilot sets the stage for scale up phaseof 150,000 users. This creates tangible use cases that encourage developers, fintechs, and NGOs to build on Cardano, expanding its adoption and network effects.
3. Builds Credibility & Trust: By providing UNDP and other stakeholders with tamper-proof, auditable systems, the project reinforces Cardano’s reputation as a reliable blockchain for socially impactful, high-integrity solutions. This attracts institutional partners and grants future ecosystem growth opportunities.
4. Generates Knowledge & Best Practices: Investment supports evaluation, optimization, and documentation of the pilot, creating reusable frameworks, smart contract templates, and operational lessons that can benefit future Cardano projects globally.
5. Social & Economic Impact as Marketing: Each successful loan disbursement and beneficiary story highlights Cardano’s role in driving financial inclusion, strengthening ecosystem visibility and positioning Cardano as the blockchain of choice for impact-driven solutions.
